title: GitHub Copilot Session File Schema Documentation
description: This document describes the structure of session log files created by GitHub Copilot Chat extension. These files are used by the Copilot Token Tracker extension to calculate token usage statistics.

workspace.description: Session files for workspace-specific Copilot chats

global.description: Session files for empty window (no workspace) Copilot chats

copilot_cli.description: Session files for Copilot CLI/Agent mode (JSONL format, one JSON object per line)

remote_server.description: Session files in remote/server environments (Codespaces, WSL, SSH remotes)
remote_server.note: These paths are checked by the extension but not by the analysis script (which is Windows-focused)

copilot_chat_global.description: Additional session files from GitHub Copilot Chat extension

json.description: Standard JSON session files from VS Code Copilot Chat

jsonl.description: JSON Lines format for Copilot CLI sessions (one JSON object per line)

jsonSessionFileSchema.description: Schema for standard .json session files from VS Code Copilot Chat

version.description: Schema version number for the session file format
version.usedBy: Extension does not currently use this field

responderUsername.description: Display name of the AI assistant responding
responderUsername.usedBy: Extension does not currently use this field

responderAvatarIconUri.description: Icon identifier for the AI assistant's avatar

id.description: Icon ID from VS Code icon theme

responderAvatarIconUri.usedBy: Extension does not currently use this field

initialLocation.description: Where the chat was initially opened (e.g., 'panel', 'editor')
initialLocation.usedBy: Extension does not currently use this field

requests.description: Array of user interactions (requests) and AI responses in this session
requests.usedBy: PRIMARY DATA SOURCE - Extension reads message.parts[].text for input tokens and response[].value for output tokens. Array length used to count interactions.

sessionId.description: Unique identifier for this chat session (UUID format)
sessionId.usedBy: Extension does not currently use this field

creationDate.description: Unix timestamp (milliseconds) when the session was created
creationDate.usedBy: Extension does not currently use this field

lastMessageDate.description: Unix timestamp (milliseconds) of the last message in the session
lastMessageDate.usedBy: Extension does not currently use this field (uses file modification time instead)

customTitle.description: User-defined title for the chat session (optional)
customTitle.usedBy: Extension does not currently use this field

hasPendingEdits.description: Whether the session has edits waiting to be applied
hasPendingEdits.usedBy: Extension does not currently use this field

contrib.usedBy: Extension does not currently use this field

attachments.description: Files or resources attached to the session
attachments.usedBy: Extension does not currently use this field

mode.usedBy: Extension does not currently use this field

selectedModel.description: Currently selected AI model for the session

metadata.description: Model metadata including name, family, version, capabilities

selectedModel.usedBy: Extension does not use selectedModel; it reads model info from individual request.result.details instead

inputText.description: Current input text in the chat box (may be empty)
inputText.usedBy: Extension does not currently use this field

selections.description: Editor selections/cursor positions when chat was opened
selections.usedBy: Extension does not currently use this field

requestObjectSchema.description: Schema for each request object in the requests array

requestId.description: Unique identifier for this request (UUID format)
requestId.usedBy: Extension does not currently use this field

text.description: Full text of the user's message
text.example: fix the x axis in the chart

parts.description: Message broken into parts (text, code, attachments)

range.description: Character range in the full message

editorRange.description: Line and column range if from editor

message.usedBy: PRIMARY DATA SOURCE - Extension reads message.parts[].text to estimate input tokens

variableData.description: Data for variables referenced in the message (e.g., @workspace)
variableData.usedBy: Extension does not currently use this field

response.description: Array of response items from the AI assistant
response.usedBy: PRIMARY DATA SOURCE - Extension reads response[].value fields (strings) to estimate output tokens

agent.description: Information about the agent that handled this request
agent.usedBy: Extension does not currently use this field

timestamp.description: Unix timestamp (milliseconds) when the request was made
timestamp.usedBy: Extension does not currently use this field

modelId.description: Model identifier used for this specific request
modelId.usedBy: Extension does not currently use this field (uses result.details instead)

responseId.usedBy: Extension does not currently use this field

metadata.description: Additional metadata including rendered contexts, tool calls, etc.

details.description: Human-readable details about the model used

result.usedBy: Extension reads result.details to identify the AI model used (e.g., 'Claude Opus 4.5', 'GPT-4.1')

responseMarkdownInfo.description: Information about markdown rendering in the response
responseMarkdownInfo.usedBy: Extension does not currently use this field

followups.description: Suggested follow-up questions from the AI
followups.usedBy: Extension does not currently use this field

modelState.description: State of the model after processing
modelState.usedBy: Extension does not currently use this field

contentReferences.description: References to content used in the request (files, images, etc.)

reference.description: The referenced content (file URI, variable, etc.)

contentReferences.usedBy: Extension does not currently use this field

codeCitations.description: Citations to code snippets from public repositories
codeCitations.usedBy: Extension does not currently use this field

timeSpentWaiting.description: Time spent waiting for user interaction (milliseconds)
timeSpentWaiting.usedBy: Extension does not currently use this field

responseItemSchema.description: Schema for individual items in the response array. Response arrays contain heterogeneous items with different 'kind' values.

variants.description: Text content from the AI's response

value.usedBy: PRIMARY DATA SOURCE - Extension estimates output tokens from this text

supportThemeIcons.description: Whether theme icons are supported in rendering

supportHtml.description: Whether HTML is supported in rendering

baseUri.description: Base URI for resolving relative links

variants.description: Notification that MCP (Model Context Protocol) servers are starting

didStartServerIds.description: Array of MCP server IDs that started

variants.usedBy: Extension does not use this response type

variants.description: Reference to inline content (e.g., code block, file)
variants.usedBy: Extension does not use this response type

toolName.description: Name of the tool being prepared

variants.usedBy: Extension does not use this response type

pastTenseMessage.description: Past tense description of the action

toolCallId.description: Unique ID for this tool call

generatedTitle.description: Generated title for the tool call

variants.usedBy: Extension does not use this response type
Extension does not use this response type

variants.description: URI reference to a code block

isEdit.description: Whether this is an edit operation

variants.usedBy: Extension does not use this response type

variants.description: Group of text edits to be applied

uri.description: URI of the file to edit

variants.usedBy: Extension does not use this response type

variants.description: AI's internal reasoning/thinking process (shown in UI)

value.usedBy: Extension may estimate tokens from this value

generatedTitle.description: Generated title for this thinking block

variants.usedBy: Extension may use 'value' field for token estimation

jsonlSessionFileSchema.description: Schema for JSONL session files from Copilot CLI. Each line is a separate JSON object representing an event.
jsonlSessionFileSchema.format: One JSON object per line (JSON Lines format)

parentId.description: Parent event ID (null for root events)

eventTypes.usedBy: Extension does not currently use this event type

eventTypes.description: Informational session event (e.g., authentication, MCP connection)
eventTypes.usedBy: Extension does not currently use this event type
PRIMARY DATA SOURCE - Extension reads data.content to estimate input tokens and counts these events for interactions
Extension does not currently use this event type
Extension does not currently use this event type

toolRequests.description: Tool calls requested by the assistant

eventTypes.usedBy: PRIMARY DATA SOURCE - Extension reads data.content to estimate output tokens
Extension does not currently use this event type (could potentially use actual token counts in future)
Extension does not currently use this event type

toolTelemetry.description: Telemetry data for the tool execution

eventTypes.usedBy: Extension does not currently use this event type
Extension reads data.output to estimate input tokens (tool outputs become context)

timestamp.description: ISO 8601 timestamp when the event occurred

parentId.description: ID of the parent event, forming an event chain. Null for root events.

model.description: AI model identifier (optional, may not be present in all events)

extensionUsageSummary.description: Summary of which fields the Copilot Token Tracker extension actually uses

json_files.input_tokens: requests[].message.parts[].text - All text parts of user messages
json_files.output_tokens: requests[].response[].value - String values in response items
json_files.model_identification: requests[].result.details - Parsed to identify AI model used (e.g., 'Claude Opus 4.5', 'GPT-4.1')

jsonl_files.tool_context: Lines with type='tool.result': data.output field (counted as input tokens)
jsonl_files.model_identification: event.model field (defaults to 'gpt-4o' if not present)

fileMetadata.modification_time: File mtime is used to filter files by date (today, this month) instead of using timestamps in the JSON
fileMetadata.file_path: Path is parsed to determine editor type (workspace vs global vs CLI)

tokenEstimation.note: Extension does NOT use actual token counts from session.truncation events; it estimates based on text length

ignoredFields: Most metadata fields like sessionId, creationDate, agent info, etc.
UI-related fields like selections, inputText, mode
Response items without 'value' fields (mcpServersStarting, toolInvocationSerialized, etc.)
selectedModel at session level (uses per-request model info instead)
Actual token counts in JSONL session.truncation events

notes.fileModificationTime: The extension uses file modification time (mtime) to determine which date a session belongs to, not the timestamps inside the JSON. This means a session file modified today counts toward today's stats even if the conversation timestamps are older.
notes.modelDetection: Model identification is heuristic-based, parsing strings like 'Claude Opus 4.5' from result.details or using the model field in JSONL events. It may not be 100% accurate for all model variants.
notes.tokenEstimation: Token counts are ESTIMATES based on character counts and model-specific ratios. They are not actual token counts from the API.
notes.caching: The extension caches parsed session data using file modification time as the cache key to avoid re-parsing unchanged files.
notes.editorTypes: Files are categorized by location: 'workspace' (workspaceStorage), 'global' (globalStorage/emptyWindowChatSessions), 'cli' (Copilot CLI), 'copilot-chat' (globalStorage/github.copilot-chat)
